snippet: Federal laws do not let Americans get green cards for same-sex partners, so often the immigrant must choose to stay illegally or the couple must move.
abstract: Manhattan attorney Brandon Perlberg is part of a diaspora of gay Americans who have found they had to uproot and leave the country if they want to continue living with their foreign-born same-sex partners; federal laws, including the Defense of Marriage Act, do not let Americans obtain permanent resident visas, or green cards, for same-sex partners; Perlberg and his partner of more than 7 years have relocated to London.
lead_paragraph: Federal laws do not let Americans get green cards for same-sex partners, so often the immigrant must choose to stay illegally or the couple must move.

headline.main: With No Shortcut to a Green Card, Gay Couples Leave U.S.
headline.print_headline: Forced to Choose: Love or Country
